meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins remained inviolate despite the passing of time.
meanings.sent2: The treaty ensured that the borders of the country would remain inviolate.
meanings.sent3: The inviolate forest whispered secrets to those who dared to listen.
meanings.sent4: Her inviolate trust in him was like a shield against betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The inviolate snow-covered landscape sparkled in the morning sun.

meanings.definition: Not to be violated or profaned
meanings.sent1: The sacred temple was considered inviolate by the local community.
meanings.sent2: The artist's studio was his inviolate sanctuary where creativity flowed freely.
meanings.sent3: The inviolate silence of the library was broken by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: Her inviolate principles guided her actions even in the face of temptation.
meanings.sent5: The inviolate bond between the siblings was unbreakable.

meanings.sent1: The inviolate promise between friends was a bond of trust.
meanings.sent2: The inviolate nature reserve was a haven for endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The inviolate peace of the countryside was shattered by a sudden storm.
meanings.sent4: His inviolate dedication to his work earned him the respect of his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The inviolate beauty of the untouched landscape took her breath away.
